content.description:
A cool, easy traverse behind Burly that is worth scampering up a few times to warm up. It still needs a little clean up, but it's one of the better v0s at Rock Shop, I'd say.

I made up a name that hopefully is decent, but if this has FA info and a chosen name, let me know.
content.location: On the wall opposite Burly. Start down and right, and work your way up and left on good rounded holds perfect for warming up.

content.description:
An amazing line on great stone, and an area classic since it's tall, has great movement, and is aesthetically pleasing.

The top will clean up a bit with more ascents, but right now, if you stay on the good holds, it's clean enough.
content.protection: You'll want a few pads for this one if you intend to fall. If you think you might fall at this difficulty, it might be a good idea to preview on rope, and bring a brush, since there is still a lot of lichen up there.
content.location:
The obvious line left of Burly, on the tall face. The v3 way to start is with hands on good low jugs.

It's possible to add a lower start to this to the right, which goes at about v4, I guess, and has better movement still than the v3 stand. To do this one, I started with my right hand on a sloper as far right as I could go on this face, and left hand nearby, right hand crossed to a fun pinch/sloper, and then powered up left through sloper sidepulls to the good holds on the v3.

content.description: Really fun variation on the Font Simulator. Sit start down and right, then up to the lip, traverse left into better holds, and finish up Font Simulator. Good climbing.
content.location: On the Font Simulator Boulder, which is findable by passing Sliced Bread/Burly, on the marshy trail through the woods. Keep looking left, and find this boulder on it's own out in a flat space.

content.description:
The best line on Font simulator? Really good movement on cool slopers up the middle of the bugle/onto slab. Good stuff.

Now that everything has been cleaned up on this boulder, it's the most obvious line.

This one is worth a visit. Started unassumingly under the roof, with hands on the face, then stand up into a cool undercling, and reach gently over the lip and settle onto a couple of slopers. Work your way up and right to finish. Best line on the bloc.

Fun name, and if you squint your eyes a little and ignore the very clearly alpine granite sensation of climbing it, the name can be accurate.

Same start, then up and over the lip and to the left is v5-v6.

Same start, and creeping around the corner to the left is v1-2? (not as certain about this one).

There is a sit start on the right side that starts on crimps, then up onto the lip, then traverses left into the Font Simulator, and that is v6, and pretty fun.
content.location:
Super fun bloc in the woods past Slice Bread and Burly.

Pass Sliced Bread on the ten foot wide trail through the woods, and look to the left for this boulder chilling out on flat open ground.

climbs.name: Car Park Bloc
climbs.fa: Others probably got up there first. I cleaned up the lines, cleaned up the landing, cleaned the top, and moved dead sticks away.

content.description:
Solid warm up movement right next to the parking. Doesn't look like much, but it will get your body ready for harder movement. There are number of worthwhile variations on this stone.

Since they are all pretty chill, and not more than 4-5 moves at the most, I have compressed this bloc into a single route entry.

There are a few brief lines on it, though, and all warm up different parts of your body.

Line 1 is to step on in the middle of the wall, and stand up to an easy mantle. v0

Line 2 is to step up on the right, to easy mantle. v0

Line 3 is to start on the slopers on the left, and traverse all the way across the boulder, then top out hugging the bulge on the far right side. This is the most fun. v1

Line 4 is to start on the slopers on the left, paste feet on wide edges, and mantle straight up. v2
content.protection: You can probably just grab your shoes, and walk over here. A scratch pad would be nice to clean your shoes off on. The landing is soft.
content.location: Right in the parking area in the woods, on the right of the trail towards Nexus and others.

content.description: Absolutely awesome climbing on technical holds that face the wrong way. It takes some creativity and body english to climb this well. Depending on how you climb it, it can be satisfyingly shouldery/powerful.
content.location: Cross the marsh towards Nexus, then follow the ten foot wide cleared trail into the aspen grove. Look to your left. You will see a 25 foot boulder that contains Sliced Bread (v3), Burly, and others. Burly is the line on the right. Sit as low as you can and grab obvious opposing holds to start (a crimp on the right and a sloper crimp on the left if memory serves). Work up and right onto the jug finish and mildly technical rockover.
